merged_caption: The video presents a screen recording of a pixelated computer interface, framed as a direct view. Initially, the "Hypnospace Zone Hub" window occupies the left foreground. Within this window, four rectangular buttons are stacked vertically in the center: "HYPNOSPACE CENTRAL" at the top, followed by "THE CAFE," "GOODTIME VALLEY," and "HSPD HEADQUARTERS" at the bottom. A white pixelated arrow cursor, initially in the bottom center foreground, moves up and clicks on the "HSPD HEADQUARTERS" button. The screen transitions to a new page titled "HSPD Enforcer Handbook," which prominently features a large graphic on a beige background: "H S P D" in large, blue-outlined white block letters above "HEADQUARTERS" in smaller black letters, both underlined by black zig-zag lines. A "NO VIOLATION POINTS" banner is positioned at the top center foreground, with an "HSPD DISPATCH'S STATUS" box below it. As the cursor moves to the right foreground, the page content scrolls upwards: the "HSPD HEADQUARTERS" graphic moves towards the top of the window, and abstract, pastel-colored geometric shapes resembling stylized buildings scroll into view from the bottom, occupying the bottom-center foreground. The main "HYPNOSPACE EXPLORER" window, with its purple border and top title bar, remains static in the overall foreground throughout the video. The interface has a distinct pixelated, retro visual style, reminiscent of late 1990s software, with the date "1999.11.05" and time "9:04P" displayed at the top. The camera remains completely static throughout the video.

input_captions.Camera: The camera remains completely static throughout the video.
input_captions.Subject: The video displays a pixelated computer interface, reminiscent of late 1990s software, presented within a purple-bordered window labeled "HYPNOSPACE EXPLORER" and showing the date "1999.11.05" and time "9:04P." Initially, this interface, titled "Hypnospace Zone Hub," contains four dark purple rectangular buttons, each with a unique colorful pixelated icon—a purple swirl, a brown stylized face, a green landscape, and a blue emblem—and white descriptive text. A white pixelated arrow cursor clicks on the "HSPD HEADQUARTERS" button. The view then shifts to the "HSPD Enforcer Handbook" page, which prominently features a large graphic on a beige background: "H S P D" in large, blue-outlined white block letters above "HEADQUARTERS" in smaller black letters, both underlined by black zig-zag lines. Scrolling down this page reveals abstract, pastel-colored geometric shapes resembling stylized buildings at the bottom. Text elements throughout provide labels and status information, such as "NO VIOLATION POINTS."
input_captions.Motion: A white pixelated arrow cursor moves up and clicks on the "HSPD HEADQUARTERS" button. The screen transitions to a new page titled "HSPD Enforcer Handbook," which then scrolls downwards, revealing abstract geometric shapes at the bottom, while the cursor moves to the right.
input_captions.Scene: A screen recording of a software or system interface shows a purple-themed desktop environment labeled "HYPNOSPACE EXPLORER" at the top, with the date "1999.11.05" and time "9:04P" displayed. Initially, a window titled "Hypnospace Zone Hub" is active, presenting a list of clickable zones: "HYPNOSPACE CENTRAL," "THE CAFE," "GOODTIME VALLEY," and "HSPD HEADQUARTERS," each with a small icon and a short description. A white arrow cursor clicks on "HSPD HEADQUARTERS." The view transitions to a new page within this section, now titled "HSPD Enforcer Handbook." This page features a banner indicating "NO VIOLATION POINTS" and "MODEL CITIZEN," and a "HSPD DISPATCH'S STATUS" update. The central part of this page displays a large, stylized graphic with "H S P D" in large, blue-outlined letters above the word "HEADQUARTERS" in a black serif font, all set against a beige, textured background with black zig-zag borders. The interface has a distinct pixelated, retro visual style.
input_captions.Spatial: The video presents a screen recording of a pixelated computer interface, framed as a direct view. Initially, the "Hypnospace Zone Hub" window occupies the left foreground. Within this window, four rectangular buttons are stacked vertically in the center: "HYPNOSPACE CENTRAL" at the top, followed by "THE CAFE," "GOODTIME VALLEY," and "HSPD HEADQUARTERS" at the bottom. A white arrow cursor, initially in the bottom center foreground, moves to and clicks the "HSPD HEADQUARTERS" button. The view within the window then transitions to the "HSPD Enforcer Handbook." In this new view, a "NO VIOLATION POINTS" banner is positioned at the top center foreground, with an "HSPD DISPATCH'S STATUS" box below it. The central foreground is dominated by a large "HSPD HEADQUARTERS" graphic. As the cursor moves to the right foreground, the page content scrolls upwards: the "HSPD HEADQUARTERS" graphic moves towards the top of the window, and abstract geometric shapes, resembling stylized buildings, scroll into view from the bottom, occupying the bottom-center foreground. The main "HYPNOSPACE EXPLORER" window, with its purple border and top title bar, remains static in the overall foreground throughout the video.

prompt:
Please merge the following five captions into a single, comprehensive caption that describes the video completely without any redundancy.

Caption Types:
1. Subject: Describes the subjects/people in the video
2. Scene: Describes the scene composition and environment
3. Motion: Describes the movement and dynamics of subjects
4. Spatial: Describes the spatial relationships and framing
5. Camera: Describes camera movements and framing choices

Input Captions:
{captions}

Instructions:
1. Use the SPATIAL caption as your BASE structure - it provides the core visual description and framing
2. Merge MOTION and CAMERA captions into the spatial description to create a temporally coherent narrative that describes how things change over time
3. Add information from SUBJECT and SCENE captions ONLY if they contain unique details not already covered in the Spatial caption
4. Eliminate ALL redundant information - if the same detail appears in multiple captions, mention it only ONCE
5. Preserve the EXACT wording from the original captions - do NOT paraphrase
6. When describing temporal changes, integrate motion and camera movements in chronological order to show how the scene evolves
7. CRITICAL: Every unique detail from all five captions must appear in the final merged caption - nothing should be omitted
8. Do NOT add any information not present in the original captions
9. Return only the merged caption without any additional text or formatting

Goal: A single, temporally coherent caption based on the Spatial description, with Motion and Camera information merged chronologically, and Subject/Scene details added only when they provide new information. Keep as many details as possible but limit to at most 320 words.
